title: Everything new in Samsung‚Äôs next major Galaxy update, One UI 8.5, just leaked
summary: We‚Äôve been hearing tidbits here and there around Samsung‚Äôs next big Galaxy update, One UI 8.5, but now the whole changelog has leaked, revealing everything that‚Äôs new. more‚Ä¶

title: The Galaxy Z TriFold looks amazing, but I still have one big concern
summary: A 10-inch screen in your pocket sounds fantastic, but it's still subject to the same old foldable screen issues.
body: The Samsung Galaxy Z TriFold is finally official, and I‚Äôm very excited about this form factor. Conventional book-style foldables have always felt a little too small for my taste, so the prospect of a 10-inch display that fits into my pocket has me sitting up and taking notice. Despite that intrigue and excitement, though, I can‚Äôt help but feel concerned about the TriFold for one simple reason: That gigantic folding screen is still made of plastic.

title: Weezer Bassist Scott Shriner‚Äôs Wife Files For Divorce Eight Months After LAPD¬†Shootout
summary: The couple, who share two children, were married for 20 years.
body: Weezer bassist Scott Shriner’s wife, author Jillian Lauren-Shriner, has reportedly filed for divorce from the rocker after 20 years of marriage. According to a copy of the filing obtained by Billboard , Lauren-Shriner, 52, cited “irreconcilable differences” as the reason for the split, with no additional information available on the filing date, including the date of separation. The filing came eight months after Lauren-Shriner was shot by police near the couple’s home on April 8 in Los Angeles in the midst of a manhunt for three suspects in an alleged hit-and-run in the couple’s Eagle Rock neighborhood. According to police, while Lauren-Shriner was not involved in the hit-and-run incident, she allegedly fired a weapon at an officer while in a backyard after officials said she repeatedly ignored their commands to drop her gun. Lauren-Shriner was charged with two felony counts in the incident and pled not guilty on May 13 to charges of discharging a firearm with gross negligence and assault with a semiautomatic firearm; those charges were less severe than the initial charges the author faced when she was booked on suspicion of attempted murder followin‚Ä¶

title: Cardi B Snuggles With Newborn Son, Calls Him Her Little ‚ÄòCuddle¬†Buddy‚Äô
summary: The "Am I the Drama?" MC welcomed her first baby with boyfriend and NFL star Stefon Diggs last month.
body: Cardi B is starting to gear up for her first headlining tour next year, but that doesn’t mean the mother of four doesn’t make time for cuddles. According to People , in a post on her Instagram Stories earlier this week, Cardi, 33, shared a glimpse of her newborn son with boyfriend Stefon Diggs while enjoying some quiet alone time with the precious bundle she gave birth to on Nov. 13. In the snap, the boy, whose name has not yet been revealed, is spotted wearing a beige onesie covered in giraffes as he snuggles up to Cardi’s chest and rests his head on her shoulder. While the pic did not show the child’s face, the caption told you everything you needed to know about how Cardi feels about her first child with the Patriots wide receiver. “My cuddle buddy üß∏ü©∂ I love him soooo much,” Cardi wrote under the snap. It was just the latest glimpse of the newborn. Cardi posted a carousel of photos on Nov. 19 of the child, including ones of her cuddling the baby in the nursery, as well as in a hospital bed right after his birth. Cardi also has three children with ex-husband Offset: 7-year-old daughter Kulture, 4-year-old son Wave, and 1-year-old daughter Bl‚Ä¶

title: Bad Bunny Is Spotify‚Äôs Biggest Artist of 2025: See the Global Top¬†Lists
summary: Plus, "Die With A Smile" by Lady Gaga and Bruno Mars is the Global Top Song of the Year.
body: Bad Bunny dominates the majority of this year‚Äôs Spotify Wrapped Global Top Lists, which Billboard can exclusively reveal today (Dec. 3).  Overall, the Puerto Rican star ranked No. 1 as the Global Top Artist of 2025. In second place among artists is Taylor Swift, followed in order by The Weeknd, Drake, Billie Eilish, Kendrick Lamar, Bruno Mars, Ariana Grande, Arijit Singh, and Fuerza Regida. Bunny‚Äôs DeB√ç TiRAR M√°S FOToS album‚Äîwhich hit No. 1 on the Billboard 200 in January ‚Äî also ranked as the Global Top Album of 2025. The set is followed by popular productions KPop Demon Hunters (KPop Demon Hunters Cast, HUNTR/X, Saja Boys), HIT ME HARD AND SOFT (Billie Eilish), SOS Deluxe: LANA (SZA), and Short n’ Sweet (Sabrina Carpenter). Meanwhile, Lady Gaga and Bruno Mars‚Äô heartfelt “Die with a Smile” wrapped as the Global Top Song of 2025, followed by Billie Eilish’s “Birds of a Feather,” Ros√© and Bruno Mars’ “APT,” Alex Warren‚Äôs “Ordinary,” and Bad Bunny‚Äôs album title track ‚ÄúDtMF.‚Äù As for the Latin categories, M√∫sica Mexicana ranked as the No. 1 Latin genre for a second consecutive year, followed by reggaet√≥n; and among ‚Ä¶

title: Matty Healy Tells College Student That The 1975 Have a Ton of Music in the¬†Pipeline
summary: It's been more than three years since the band released its fifth studio album, "Being Funny in a Foreign Language."
body: It’s been more than three years since The 1975 released their fifth studio album, Being Funny in a Foreign Language . But according to singer Matty Healy, next year could bring a deluge of new music from the group. Healy spilled the beans on Tuesday (Dec. 2) during a chat with a fan at Gateshead College in England when he participated in a Q&A with students. The student was curious what the band meant when it flashed the word “DOGS” on a screen at the end of their Glastonbury set this summer . When the group closed out the Pyramid Stage on June 27, “DOGS” flashed on the screen in red across the stage, after it was also prominently displayed on drummer George Daniels’ drum kit during the set. Healy confirmed to the student that DOGS is the name of their upcoming album, then teased, “we made two. It might be one, it might be two… but yeah, we’ve made two albums .” At press time no additional information was available on the album(s) and a spokesperson for the group had not yet responded to Billboard ‘s request for confirmation on the band’s album release plans. According to the NME , in May, the band’s‚Ä¶

title: This $50 Android TV box is getting Gemini before your flagship TV
summary: Google is keeping its promise as the Gemini begins rolling out to Walmart's Onn 4K Pro.
body: Credit: Lanh Nguyen / Android Authority TL;DR Walmart‚Äôs budget-friendly Onn 4K Pro streaming box has started receiving Google‚Äôs Gemini assistant upgrade. Gemini replaces Google Assistant and introduces natural conversation and personalized queries for TV. While Gemini has been released for the Onn 4K Pro, Google TV Streamer, and some TCL TVs, it remains unknown when the rest of the TV streaming ecosystem will make the switch from Google Assistant. Walmart‚Äôs Onn 4K Pro is an impressive Chromecast 4K competitor that doubles up as a Google Assistant-based smart speaker. It‚Äôs a $50 streaming box that got an update to Android TV 14 some months ago. Google promised that an update to Gemini is coming ‚Äúlater this year‚Äù for the Onn 4K Pro , and it seems that the company is keeping its promise, as users have reported that Gemini is here for the streaming box. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Google Drive is getting a much needed search upgrade, but only if you pay up
summary: And agree to let Google view what's inside your files.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google is adding Gemini-powered search features to Google Drive. With this upgrade, Gemini will be able to search your files, folders, and subfolders and answer specific questions. These features are currently exclusive to Google Workspace users, which includes enterprise users and those with Gemini subscriptions. If there‚Äôs one feature Google wants to be invariably present across all of its apps and services, it‚Äôs Gemini. In addition to the Gemini gateway (part of the Google app) on Android, the assistant has, or at least some features powered by it have, slowly crept up into other Google apps, including Messages, Photos , Home , and more. For Workspace users specifically, Google also adds Gemini-based assistive features to Gmail, Drive, and the office suite, gently reminding them of its capabilities . Now, Google is expanding its prowess in Drive, offering more insights into a folder‚Äôs contents and even sharing an overview of the files and subfolders stored inside. Google recently announced it is rolling out Folder highlight, which provides a summary of a folder‚Äôs contents, elaborating on the purpose of the files it contains. It ‚Ä¶

title: How Manchester‚Äôs Aviva Studios Cemented Its Place as Industry-Leading Home For Music &¬†Arts
summary: Home of Factory International, the venue has established itself as a cornerstone of the city‚Äôs arts scene.
body: Aviva Studios is Manchester’s latest cultural powerhouse. Since October 2023, the venue has welcomed over 1.5 million visitors and is rewriting the rules of performance and creativity ‚Äì bringing music, theatre, gaming, and visual arts together under one roof. Designed by world-renowned architect Ellen van Loon, its flexible spaces and cutting-edge acoustics make it a playground for global artists and local talent alike. ‚ÄúThis is a venue of the future ‚Äì we don‚Äôt worry about old definitions of art forms. Musicians, video artists, and performers are all mixed together here,‚Äù John McGrath, artistic director and chief executive of Factory International , tells Billboard U.K. With a focus on commissioning and booking new interdisciplinary works, the non-profit arts organisation ‚Äì which produces the biennial Manchester International Festival and operates Aviva Studios ‚Äì is setting a gold standard for collaboration, positioning the building as a cultural landmark of the North. Aviva Studios Aaron Parsons Photography From the outside alone, Aviva Studios is a showstopper: an industrial feel to its exterior is complemented by the overlappings of surrounding arches and bridges. The ven‚Ä¶

title: Erase yourself from the internet: How to take back what‚Äôs yours with Incogni
summary: Incogni lets you take back control of your data online, and the promo code ANDROID55 saves you 55% on an annual plan.
body: Your name, address, phone number, SSN, family information, and even past employment history could be scattered across hundreds, sometimes thousands, of websites you‚Äôve never even heard of. Data brokers, people-search sites, and shady public databases collect and trade your personal details like currency.

title: No audio? No problem. YouTube‚Äôs new Expressive Captions carry the emotion for you
summary: Expressive Captions are rolling out now on YouTube, and they might change how you watch.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Expressive Captions finally bring emotion to YouTube subtitles, available now across all devices. The feature is now live for English videos uploaded after October 2025, with a wider rollout planned. Captions can now show tone, emphasis, and ambient cues like sighs, applause, or gasps. Standard captions have always been functional, but rarely fun. They get the job done if you‚Äôre watching on mute or have hearing accessibility needs, but they‚Äôve historically stripped the video of its emotion and energy. Well, that‚Äôs officially changing, thanks to Google‚Äôs latest accessibility updates . Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Here‚Äôs everything that could be coming with Samsung‚Äôs next big update for Galaxy phones
summary: Bixby seems all set to get much better, but users might love the lock screen and quick settings panel customizations more.
body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority TL;DR A leaked changelog suggests that One UI 8.5 will introduce major updates, including continuous AI image generation with Photo Assist, a smarter Bixby assistant, and enhanced battery-saving options. New connectivity tools such as Storage Share and enhanced Smart View access are included, alongside upgraded accessibility features, partial screen recording controls, and Quick Share improvements. One UI 8.5 beta program could begin on December 8 for the Galaxy S25 series, with a stable release expected to follow alongside the Galaxy S26 series next year. Samsung‚Äôs One UI 8.5 update is expected to be a big update for Galaxy phones. While the first stable release is likely to arrive with the Galaxy S26 series early next year, Samsung typically runs a beta program for its current-gen flagship, allowing users to try out the update before its stable release. Leaks suggest that the One UI 8.5 beta program could begin as soon as December 8 , and ahead of the date, an alleged changelog has now leaked. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Is your Pixel getting Google‚Äôs big Android 16 QPR2 update? Here‚Äôs every supported phone
summary: From the Pixel 6 to the Pixel 10, Google has you covered.
body: Google Pixel users, it‚Äôs time to buckle up for another big software update. On December 2, Google officially began rolling out Android 16 QPR2 , and it‚Äôs chock-full of new features for your Pixel phone. What kind of new features? We‚Äôre talking new app icon customization tools, better notification organization, lock screen widgets, and a whole lot more. It‚Äôs not quite as game-changing as Android 16 QPR1 was, but it‚Äôs still an excellent update nonetheless.

title: 7 things we still don‚Äôt know about the Samsung Galaxy Z TriFold
summary: Hi Samsung, I still have a lot of questions.
body: Earlier this week, Samsung announced one of its biggest products of the entire year: the Galaxy Z TriFold . After months of rumors, Samsung‚Äôs first tri-fold foldable is official. Samsung has confirmed several details about the TriFold. We know it has a 10-inch inner display, a Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, and a 200MP primary camera on the back. Samsung has also confirmed several software features to take advantage of the giant screen, including native Samsung DeX and the ability to run three apps side-by-side as if you‚Äôre using three phones at once.

title: Google seems to have nuked another useful Google Home feature
summary: And replaced it with slightly trickier option.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR Google has quietly removed the option to call your smart displays from the Google Home app on your phone. The ‚ÄúCall Home‚Äù feature allowed you to call the smart display from your phone while using the same Google account. A Redditor noted the option has vanished from the app following the recent redesign. The other alternative is to call other users over Meet, but it requires their accounts to be added to the display as well. In 2018, Google added the option to call smart displays with Google Home over Duo . While it was considered a handy option by some, the feature truly did not take off as Google had expected. The lack of user interest could partly be blamed on Google‚Äôs limited love for smart displays (including abandoning the Nest Hub itself) and on the feature being limited to folks who use US English as their default device language. Now that Meet has replaced Duo, Google seems to be killing the option to call your home devices. As noted by Reddit user chelitazz , Google appears to have removed the ‚ÄúCall Home‚Äù button from the Google Home app on Android. The button, which was previously positioned above the Broadcast option in t‚Ä¶

title: Spotify says it‚Äôs time to update your app, Wrapped 2025 could drop any moment
summary: The highly anticipated annual music recap could likely release today.
body: Credit: Spotify TL;DR Spotify Wrapped 2025 is likely about to go live. The streaming service is recommending that users update their apps. The annual recap will bring personalized stats such as your top artists, songs, genres, listening minutes, mood listening trends, and shareable story cards. Spotify is finally teasing the arrival of Wrapped 2025 , and all signs point to the highly anticipated annual recap launching within hours.

title: Google Photos 2025 Recap is here with the ability to hide unwanted faces
summary: Your Recap will show up in both the Memories carousel and the Collections tab in Google Photos.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google Photos Recap 2025 is now rolling out to users. The recap takes about a day to generate and now lets you hide certain people or photos. You can easily share your recap directly from the app to social media or messaging platforms. It‚Äôs that time of the year when you start seeing recaps and wrapped highlights everywhere across the apps and services you use. Following the recent release of YouTube Recap and YouTube Music 2025 Recap , Google is now starting to roll out the Google Photos Recap for 2025.

title: Google quietly restores a lost Pixel unlocking convenience with latest Android 16 update
summary: Screen-off Fingerprint Unlock is back on newer Pixels.
body: TL;DR The latest Android 16 update brings back the Screen-off Fingerprint Unlock feature to Pixel phones. The feature was introduced in Android 16 DP2 for the Pixel 9 series, but later expanded to older Pixel models. It was mysteriously removed in subsequent Android 16 betas, but the latest stable QPR2 update reinstates it on the Pixel 9 and above. Android‚Äôs latest update is quietly bringing back a useful fingerprint unlocking option to Pixel phones. The Screen-off Fingerprint Unlock toggle has returned in the new Android 16 QPR2 update , a.k.a the second major Android 16 update of the year . Enabling the feature lets users unlock their Pixels with the fingerprint sensor even when the display is completely off. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: This e-reader accessory finally dropped and it‚Äôs already sold out
summary: Remote-controlled page turns are here, but out of stock.
body: TL;DR Kobo‚Äôs $30 Bluetooth remote is now shipping as the company‚Äôs first official page-turning accessory. The Kobo Remote offers remote controlled page turns, months-long AAA battery life, and basic audiobook controls. Early demand wiped out the first batch, but a restock is scheduled for December 15. Kobo has officially started shipping its new Kobo Remote, a compact Bluetooth accessory that lets users flip e-reader pages without touching the device itself. The tiny, tactile controller for next- and previous-page turns isn‚Äôt a novel idea (third-party remotes have been floating around for years), but this is the first branded option built specifically for Kobo‚Äôs ecosystem, and it should offer the most seamless compatibility. summary: This month's update won't be skipping over the Pixel 6 series.

It includes a long list of fixes, including a fix for the ‚ÄúExtra Dim‚Äù Quick Settings title and fingerprint unlock issues. It‚Äôs a new month and that means a new software update is coming to Pixel devices. Unlike last month and the few before it, this update won‚Äôt be skipping over the Pixel 6 series. The rollout is just starting and it‚Äôs expected to continue over the next week in phases, so you may not see the update right away. title: Google TV is hopping on the year-end recap bandwagon
summary: You can now browse lists of Google TV's 'most watched' content of 2025.
body: TL;DR Google TV now features lists of the ‚Äòmost watched‚Äô content of 2025. The lists feature shows and movies that got a lot of clicks on the Google TV home screen. In keeping with tradition, Google TV‚Äôs annual advent calendar is also now available. The year‚Äôs drawing to a close, and you know what that means: it‚Äôs content consumption recap season. Joining YouTube Music , YouTube proper has started rolling out its first-ever personalized video Recap , and now, Google TV‚Äôs sharing what its users have been streaming this year, too. Google TV‚Äôs end-of-year lists aren‚Äôt personalized the way YouTube‚Äôs are, but the platform is offering insight into what people have been watching in 2025 generally. New lists available on Google TV devices and in the Google TV app highlight viewers‚Äô ‚Äúmost watched‚Äù movies (James Gunn‚Äôs Superman is up there) and TV shows (Love Island is a hit), and a newly added advent calendar (prominently sponsored by Target) offers a different holiday movie to check out every day through Christmas.

summary: Here's when the Nothing Phone 3a Community Edition will launch.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR Nothing will soon launch its second-ever Community Edition phone. The launch of the Phone 3a Community Edition is scheduled for December 9, 2025. Fans can apply to be at the launch event in person. London-based phone maker Nothing gave us a cryptic teaser to chew on just before Thanksgiving last week. That teaser was a picture of an off-colored version of the Pok√©mon Arcanine. Just as we suspected, this was a teaser for the community edition of the Nothing Phone 3a. Now the company has revealed when you‚Äôll be able to get your hands on one. title: Good news for custom ROMs: Google just released the Android 16 QPR2 source code
summary: Immediately after rolling out the update to Pixel devices, Google has released the source code for Android 16 QPR2.
body: TL;DR Google has started uploading the source code for Android 16 QPR2 to AOSP following its release for Pixel devices today. This marks a return to form for Google after the company surprisingly withheld the source code for Android 16 QPR1 for two months. Developers can now access the new code on the AOSP Git repositories under the ‚Äúandroid-16.0.0_r4‚Äù tag to begin building custom ROMs. Earlier today, Google rolled out the big Android 16 QPR2 update for all Tensor-powered Pixel devices. While technically classified as a minor update, it‚Äôs anything but; it brings a wealth of new customization options, productivity features, security improvements, and developer APIs. Following the release, we wondered when Google would share the source code. We didn‚Äôt have to wait long: Google has already begun uploading Android 16 QPR2‚Äôs source code to the Android Open Source Project ( AOSP ), giving independent developers the opportunity to build their own operating systems based on the latest release. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Is ChatGPT not working for you? Here‚Äôs how you can try to fix it
summary: ChatGPT won't load for you? We've got a few fixes for you to try.
body: Credit: Mahmoud Itani / Android Authority ChatGPT has quickly turned into one of the most visited websites on the internet, and it‚Äôs not hard to see why. The chatbot can write essays, brainstorm ideas, and even generate code, making it an important resource that many now rely on. But what if it‚Äôs not working for you? For those unfortunate times when ChatGPT is down, we‚Äôve put together a list of potential solutions you can try to get it running again. Check if ChatGPT is down Give ChatGPT some time to recover Check your internet connection Log out and log back in Try incognito mode or a different browser Use the ChatGPT smartphone app Clear your browser‚Äôs settings and cache Try a ChatGPT alternative Check if ChatGPT is down The first thing you should do is check if the servers hosting ChatGPT itself are down right now or facing connectivity issues. Such disruptions were common in the early days of the service, as the company struggled to meet the ever-increasing user demand.

title: Worried that text is a scam? Circle to Search now has your back
summary: Circle to Search's latest upgrade turns it into a scam detector.
body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority TL;DR Google has introduced a new feature to Circle to Search. You‚Äôll now be able to circle a message to find out if it‚Äôs a scam or not. Circling a message will bring up an AI Overview that provides relevant guidance and suggested next steps. By design, scams are difficult to suss out on your own. While some are easier to spot than others, there are times when scams are nearly indistinguishable from the real thing. To help you stay safe from those attempting to take advantage of you, Google is giving you a new way to fight the scammers through Circle to Search . Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Google‚Äôs second big Android 16 update is rolling out for Pixel phones: Here‚Äôs EVERYTHING new!
summary: The Android 16 QPR2 update brings new customization options, notification features, lock screen widgets, and much more.
body: Google is ending the year with a bang by releasing another big Android update. Today, the company is rolling out the second quarterly platform release of Android 16 ‚Äî known as Android 16 QPR2 ‚Äî for the Pixel 6 series and newer. While this update may not be quite as massive as the first quarterly drop , it‚Äôs still a significant release packed with new customization options, productivity features, security enhancements, and more. Here‚Äôs everything new in Android 16 QPR2! The best new customization options in Android 16 QPR2 Auto-themed icons If you want a more uniform home screen, you‚Äôll want to enable Android‚Äôs Themed Icons feature. Introduced in Android 13, this feature tints app icons to match the system theme, creating a more visually cohesive look. Unfortunately, it relies on developers providing monochromatic versions of their icons. Since many developers haven‚Äôt done so, users are often left with a hodgepodge of themed and unthemed icons when the feature is turned on.

title: Android just entered a new era of frequent updates with the latest Android 16 release
summary: Google rolled out its second major Android 16 update today, and it's not to be confused with a Pixel Drop.
body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority TL;DR Google has released the second major Android 16 update, marking a shift away from the traditional single yearly OS upgrade. Starting with Android 16, Google will push out more frequent releases that include bigger features and new developer APIs. The update is rolling out now to eligible Pixel devices, with broader availability expected later. Google has started rolling out what it‚Äôs calling the second Android 16 update . Arriving first on eligible Pixel devices, the update might look like a typical Pixel Drop given its Pixel-first rollout. However, Google is framing it differently due to its overhauled Android update schedule announced last year.

title: Google‚Äôs new ‚ÄòCall Reason‚Äô feature might just save you from ignoring the wrong call
summary: Google has introduced an 'urgent' call tag to stop important calls from being missed.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is fixing the no-context problem in phone calls by adding an urgent-call indicator to the Phone app. The new ‚ÄúCall Reason‚Äù feature lets you flag a call as urgent so the recipient knows it matters before picking up. It only works with your saved contacts for now. Phone calls always show up with zero context, so most people just ignore them. Whether you‚Äôre busy or out with friends, it‚Äôs easy to assume it can wait. The problem is that real emergencies ‚Äî like your car stalling or getting locked out of your house ‚Äî end up treated the same way. You can‚Äôt tell what matters until it‚Äôs too late. Google is finally tackling this issue with a new feature for the Phone by Google app . Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Android 16 QPR2 rolling out with December 2025 security update

title: Gemini is getting a ChatGPT-flavored tweak and new Maps features
summary: That new tools menu looks familiar...
body: TL;DR Gemini‚Äôs tool menu is getting a redesign that looks a lot like ChatGPT. Google is also working to bring new Maps integration to Gemini. These features are not yet publicly available, but may be soon. OpenAI is evidently pretty concerned over Gemini‚Äôs increasing marketshare, with the company reportedly entering ‚Äú code red ‚Äù this week in an effort to improve ChatGPT‚Äôs performance. Today, we spotted some upcoming tweaks to the Gemini app interface that won‚Äôt help OpenAI execs sleep any easier: An in-progress update borrows heavily from OpenAI‚Äôs chatbot app, reorganizing tools in a way that‚Äôll make ChatGPT converts feel right at home. title: Motorola Edge 70 Ultra finally comes into view with its first leaked image
summary: The leaked render reveals a textured back, sleek colors, and a new side button.
body: Credit: Evan Blass TL;DR A new leaked render provides our first look at the Motorola Edge 70 Ultra, showcasing two textured finishes and a refreshed rear design. The image from Android Headlines reveals a triple-camera setup, an extra side button, and a grippy-looking back, but no view of the front display. Other recent leaks suggest a Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 chip, 16GB of RAM, and a 1.5K OLED screen. Motorola just rolled out the Edge 70 in global markets, but the company clearly isn‚Äôt slowing down. A new render shows what‚Äôs purported to be the first official image of the Motorola Edge 70 Ultra, hinting at where the next flagship is headed. The leaked image comes from Android Headlines , which didn‚Äôt disclose its source. The phone appears in two finishes that look like a dark graphite model and a bronze-green one, and both look quite different from the smoother eco-leather style of the standard Edge 70. The Motorola logo sits in the middle and seems to blend with each color, and the back texture looks more like something meant to add grip than decoration.

title: AT&T customers affected by 2024 breach qualify for even more than expected
summary: AT&T‚Äôs data breach settlement offers payouts up to $7,500, with eligibility tied to the type of data exposed.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR AT&T‚Äôs data breach settlement has been fully reached. It will offer maximum payments to $7,500 and a new claim deadline of December 18. Eligibility is based on the severity of leaked data, with payouts ranging from $100 to $7,500. Claims can be filed online with a Class Member ID or by mailing a printed form, and payments are expected in early to mid-2026. We first reported on a major AT&T data breach settlement back in August , which at the time was set to pay up to $177 million in total, with impacted customers able to claim upwards of $5,000. While this was originally supposed to happen back in November, it seems the dates and planned payouts have shifted a bit. As first reported by IBT , the final breakdown will see some users paid as much as $7,500, and the new deadline to file is December 18. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Google might soon show your phone‚Äôs IMEI on the lock screen, but should you be worried?
summary: After previously rejecting the idea as a security risk, code suggests Google is reconsidering it for its pros.
body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR Code found in the Google Personal Safety app suggests a new ‚ÄúDevice info‚Äù option will allow users to view their IMEI number from the Emergency screen without unlocking the phone. This move contradicts Google‚Äôs previous rejection of a similar user request, where the company cited security risks and the sensitive nature of PII as reasons to keep the IMEI hidden on locked devices. While the feature could help law enforcement return lost or stolen devices without seizing or wiping data, it raises concerns that malicious actors could misuse the easily accessible identifier. Every single phone, Android or otherwise, has an IMEI number . The IMEI number is a unique identifier that identifies a device on a mobile network, much like a personal identification number. It‚Äôs generally a good idea not to reveal or broadcast your phone‚Äôs IMEI number, just to avoid sharing it with malicious actors. However, there are situations where easier access to a phone‚Äôs IMEI number might have been useful. The latest release of the Personal Safety app, v2025.11.13.831777920, includes code that suggests Google may soon allow access to your phone‚Äôs IMEI number f‚Ä¶

title: This Galaxy Buds 4 gesture could supercharge Samsung‚Äôs real-time Interpreter mode
summary: Not having to pull out your phone every time could mean not missing the beginning of conversations.
body: TL;DR Samsung currently offers a real-time Interpreter mode on Galaxy Buds models for translating speech. Once started, users can pinch the stems on their Buds 3 to pause or resume translation. With the Buds 4, Samsung appears to be upgrading Interpreter to let you initiate a translation session through that same pinch gesture. With December now upon us, 2026 is right around the corner, and the new year is set to bring us all manner of new product launches. One of the first we‚Äôll be looking forward to is Samsung‚Äôs Galaxy S26 series, but we‚Äôve got more than just phones on our radar, as we‚Äôre also anticipating Samsung‚Äôs next generation of Galaxy Buds earbuds. We‚Äôve already taken an early look at the Buds 4 and Buds 4 Pro design , as well as previewed some animations showing off new Buds 4 functionality . title: One of my favorite Google TV features has nothing to do with streaming
summary: When I set up this feature on a whim, I didn't realize it would bring me so much joy.
body: I recently switched my streaming box from an older Android TV device to one with the latest version of Google TV . I‚Äôve never been very fussy about my streaming device‚Äôs interface, so long as it works, is responsive, and allows me to easily access the apps I use to watch movies and shows. But I was pleasantly surprised when the Google TV device prompted me to set specific albums from my Google Photos account for my screensaver ‚Äî a feature that has quickly become one of my favorites.

title: Wish your Game Boy was huge and played PS2 games? Meet the RG 477V
summary: Powerful specs and a wonderful screen might this one hard to beat.
body: TL;DR ANBERNIC has revealed a new vertical handheld called the RG 477V via YouTube. The name implies it will have a 4:3 4.7-inch 120Hz screen and a Dimensity 8300 chipset. No word on pricing or availability yet, but it is expected to launch within the next few weeks. Another month, another ANBERNIC handheld. The company has been speedrunning its retro gaming handheld releases in the latter half of 2025, but today‚Äôs reveal might be something special for fans of retro gaming. The ANBERNIC RG 477V, which was thoroughly leaked last month , is a new vertical handheld that brings together the best components of the company‚Äôs 2025 releases in a new form factor. As the name implies, it will have the same 4:3, 4.7-inch 120Hz IPS display as the RG Slide and RG 477M , which is one of the most impressive panels we‚Äôve tested for retro games. The video also shows exceptionally small bezels, which isn‚Äôt the case for other vertical handhelds like the Retroid Pocket Classic .

title: Google‚Äôs Recorder app update tweaks a key audio feature
summary: The Clear Voice tool gets a name change and a warning about storage use.
body: Pixel Recorder Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority TL;DR Google is rolling out a new update to the Recorder app for Pixel devices, introducing the new account switcher UI. The ‚ÄúClear Voice‚Äù feature has been renamed to ‚ÄúAuto Clear Voice,‚Äù and Google now notes that the feature uses more storage. A new chip on the playback screen appears when audio is enhanced with Clear Voice, allowing you to revert to the original audio if needed. Google added a Clear Voice toggle to the Recorder app for Pixels in December 2024, shortly after we had spotted the feature in development . Clear Voice reduces background noise during recording, making it quite handy for recordings. Google is now rolling out Recorder v4.2.20251104 to users, introducing a few changes to the Clear Voice feature, as well as introducing the account switcher into the app. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

The feature has been a fixture on Galaxy foldables for years now, allowing for hands-free photos and more. The YouTuber‚Äôs video also shows that you can‚Äôt use the TriFold screen when it‚Äôs folded once. Samsung has finally launched the Galaxy Z TriFold , offering a dual-folding 10-inch screen for an even bigger display in your pocket. Now, a YouTuber has confirmed that the device skips a long-standing Galaxy foldable feature. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Updated Android Security Bulletin sets stage for a hefty December 2025 security patch
summary: With fixes expected to arrive soon.
body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority TL;DR Google has published the December 2025 Security Bulletin, revealing a long list of severe vulnerabilities in Android. These issues are expected to be patched with device-specific security updates dated December 05. The list includes a few critical vulnerabilities in the Android Framework and at the system level. Google has just released the Android Security Bulletin for December 2025, with a roster of all vulnerabilities that affect Android devices. Unlike the frequent Pixel (or manufacturer-specific) security updates , this bulletin lists all potential vulnerabilities that impact Android devices. These vulnerabilities, affecting Android 13 or later, will be patched in the Android security update dated December 05, 2025, and delivered to your devices when the manufacturer releases the security update .

The YouTuber calls the Galaxy Z TriFold Samsung‚Äôs most ‚Äúdefinitive foldable,‚Äù because it offers both a true smartphone mode and a true tablet mode. title: Google is teasing an ‚Äòexciting‚Äô Android XR livestream, and you can preview it now

body: TL;DR Google‚Äôs next release of The Android Show is all about Android XR, and it‚Äôll be packed with ‚Äúexciting‚Äù updates. Viewers can sign up to be notified via YouTube or email and add the livestream event to their Google Calendar. The livestream is set for December 8 starting at 10 AM PT, and will last 30 minutes. title: Early look: Gemini‚Äôs ChatGPT-style ‚Äòprojects‚Äô are taking shape
summary: Here's how Google Gemini projects will work.
body: TL;DR Google Gemini has been working on a new ‚Äúprojects‚Äù option, much like ChatGPT already offers. Projects will allow you to sort files and chats around particular topics. After recently only finding some bare-bones references to Gemini projects in the UI, we can now get a much more flesh-out look at how it will operate. Right now you‚Äôve got your pick of AI platforms, and while some are certainly more popular than others, many tend to offer the same ‚Äî or at least very similar ‚Äî functionality. And why not? When a feature works well, everyone‚Äôs going to want to implement their own version of it. Recently we‚Äôve been thinking about that in the context of ChatGPT‚Äôs support for projects ‚Äî compartmentalized workspaces where you can keep files and discussions about something isolated from the rest of what you‚Äôre working on. It‚Äôs been looking like Gemini has been preparing its own take on projects , and now we can finally give you a preview.
